name: The U.S. and the World
description: Collectively, immigrants, businesspeople, investors, missionaries, writers and musicians may have been as important as diplomatsâ€™ geopolitical strategies in creating networks of connection and exchange between the United States and the world. This course focuses on the changing importance and interactions over time of key groups of state and non-state actors.
prerequisites: 1.0 credit at the A-level in AFS, GAS or HIS courses
